title: Marketplace Five Star Rating, Paramount Health Care

content.content:
Paramount's Health Insurance Marketplace© plans received 5 out of 5 stars for quality from the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) for the 2023 plan year.

"This year’s 5-star rating is evidence that Paramount is providing the best experience for its members and offers high quality plans for those shopping on the Health Insurance Marketplace,” said Dee Ann Bialecki-Haase, MD, MBA, CPE, chief medical officer, Paramount Healthcare.

The CMS rating is based on medical care, member experience, and plan administration. One star is the lowest rating; five stars is the highest rating. The overall rating and additional rating categories are publicly displayed on HealthCare.gov to assist with consumer plan comparison

Learn more about our quality Paramount Marketplace plans. Marketplace open enrollment period runs Nov. 1 – Jan.15.

title: Paramount Elite's (HMO) Medicare Plans Receive High Star Rating from CMS, Paramount Health Care

content.content:
We are thrilled to share that for 2023 Paramount’s Medicare Advantage plans, called Paramount Elite (HMO), received 4.5 out 5 stars from the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS). CMS publishes Star Ratings for Medicare Advantage (Medicare Part C) and Medicare Part D plans each year.

“Achieving 4.5 out of 5 stars for 2023 is especially rewarding in this challenging post-pandemic environment. While our star rating increased from 4 to 4.5 out of 5 stars, the average star rating for Medicare Advantage plans decreased from 4.37 stars to 4.15 out of 5 stars,” explained Holly Zorz, team lead for Medicare quality improvement, Paramount.

What are Medicare Star Ratings?

The rating system helps Medicare consumers compare the quality of health plans and rounds out benefit and cost information to support shopping decisions.

Every health plan is rated against the same criteria to give consumers a fair quality and performance comparison of the plans in their area. Medicare evaluates a plan’s staying healthy programs, care coordination, access to care and medication, managing chronic conditions, member experience and satisfaction, pharmacy services, and customer service.

CMS uses a five-star quality rating system to evaluate the quality and performance of Medicare Advantage health plans. One star is the lowest rating; five stars is the highest.

To learn more about a Medicare Advantage plan from Paramount Elite, call us at 888-891-0707 (TTY 888-740-5670). Or, come to one of our Medicare workshops and talk face-to-face with an expert. To find a workshop near you, visit paramounthealthcare.com/workshops.

Paramount Elite is an HMO plan with a Medicare contract. Enrollment in Paramount Elite depends on contract renewal.

content.content:

title: It's Open Enrollment for Medicare until December 7, Paramount Health Care

content.content:
Are you wondering what to look for in a Medicare plan this year?

It’s that time of year again – Medicare Annual Enrollment Period (AEP) from Oct. 15 – Dec. 7. It’s important to review your plan every year to make sure that it still meets your health and well-being needs.

Whether you are new to Medicare or an experienced shopper, this article will help you decide what is most important to you. Then it provides a few easy-to-follow next steps.

Questions to ask yourself:

  • Are you happy with your doctors?
  • Are you happy with the amount you’re paying in premiums?
  • How about the amount you’re paying in copays?
  • Are you comfortable with your prescription coverage?
  • Do you like the facilities, hospitals and pharmacies that are covered under your plan?
  • Do you feel your deductible is a good fit for your budget?
  • Do you think the coverage outside your area suits your travel needs?
  • Does your plan have enhanced benefits you value, like the SilverSneakers® Fitness program?

If you answered no to more than one or two of these, it’s definitely worth looking into a new plan. It doesn’t mean you have to change, but you may find one you like better. Or you may realize the one you have isn’t so bad.

If you do want to change, there is always the Annual Enrollment Period which runs from Oct. 15 to Dec 7 every year. Of course, there may also be Special Election Periods throughout the year.

Ready to start investigating different Medicare plans?

See if a Paramount Elite Medicare plan is right for you. Give us a call at 888-891-0707 (TTY 888-740-5670). Or, come to one of our Medicare workshops and talk face-to-face with an expert. To find a workshop near you, visit paramounthealthcare.com/workshops.

Paramount Elite is an HMO plan with a Medicare contract. Enrollment in Paramount Elite depends on contract renewal.

title: New for Paramount Employer-Sponsored and Marketplace Health Plans, Paramount Health Care

content.content:
Reimbursement for over-the-counter COVID-19 at-home test kits

Earlier this week, the Biden-Harris Administration announced new federal guidelines that require private health insurance plans to cover the costs for over-the-counter COVID-19 diagnostic tests purchased on or after Jan. 15, 2022.

The new coverage requirement means that members of Paramount employer-sponsored or Marketplace health plans can go online or to a pharmacy or store, buy a test, and either get it paid for up front by Paramount or get reimbursed for the cost by submitting a claim to Paramount.

  • Based on the guidelines provided by the Biden administration, Paramount will cover up to eight over-the-counter at-home COVID-19 tests per 30-day period for each person covered under your plan.
  • Tests must be approved, cleared or authorized by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration.
  • You can only get reimbursed for tests purchased on Jan. 15, 2022 or later.
  • These tests don’t require an order from your physician to qualify for reimbursement.
  • Tests must be used to diagnose a potential COVID-19 infection. Tests used for employment, school or recreational purposes are not eligible for reimbursement.

Note: This new coverage reimbursement policy doesn't apply to members who have Paramount Medicare, Medicare Supplement or Medicaid health plans.

Learn more about COVID at-home test kit reimbursement.
View COVID resources for Paramount members.

title: Vaccinated Children on Medicaid Approved to Receive $100 Gift Card, Paramount Health Care

content.content:
Vaccinated Children on Medicaid Approved to Receive $100 Gift Card

CDC Approval Makes Protection Available to Ages 5 to 11

From the Ohio Association of Health Plans
Policy, Partnership, Advocacy
Nov. 12, 2021

COLUMBUS, Ohio — For Ohio Medicaid members, heading into the holidays can feel safer and more secure as younger children, from age 5 to 11, can now get vital vaccine protection from COVID-19. Their families also can have extra income for the holidays: younger children in Ohio Medicaid Managed Care plans are eligible for a $100 gift card when they receive the first shot, just as their older family members have been.  

This comes as the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) gives the green light for 28 million kids in the 5 to 11 age group to get the vaccine. According to the Ohio Department of Health, 206,000 COVID-19 cases have occurred in Ohio children 17 and younger and 2,000 of those have required hospitalization. 

The timing of this vaccine for preadolescent children is critical as Ohio heads into the winter months and indoor gatherings rise — two factors that have historically increased the number of COVID-19 cases,” said Kelly O’Reilly, president and CEO of the Ohio Association of Health Plans. “According to the medical directors of our health plans, greatly increasing the number of vaccinated people is the key to ending the pandemic.

Working together, Ohio’s Medicaid Managed Care plans — Aetna, Buckeye Health Plan, CareSource, Molina Healthcare, Paramount Advantage and UnitedHealthcare — made finding and getting the vaccine easier than ever with Vax on the Spot, a website with information on community vaccine events, transportation solutions and walk-in opportunities at pharmacies.  

Understanding that parents and caregivers have concerns about the safety of the vaccines and possible side effects and long-term effects, the health plans have included on the Vax on the Spot site a Q&A page outlining key facts: The vaccines are safe for children and for pregnant women, and the risks of contracting COVID-19 are greater than any risk associated with receiving the vaccine. 

Provider Reimbursement 

As part of this initiative, the health plans also have expanded a $100 vaccination reimbursement payment for providers and pharmacists. Rather than solely on the first dose, the reimbursement payments now apply when each dose, including boosters, is given of the Pfizer-BioNTech, Johnson & Johnson’s Janssen and Moderna COVID-19 vaccinations. 

The expanded payments for providers are another tool for overcoming hesitancy, as they make it feasible for pharmacists and other providers to take the time to counsel patients and caregivers about their concerns. 

Campaign is Working 

In a new video highlighting the Vax on the Spot campaign, health plans, providers and community partners explain how they worked collaboratively to educate and vaccinate vulnerable Ohioans. Medicaid members also share personal accounts of why they finally decided to get the vaccine.  

To date more than 977,000 people in the Medicaid program have received at least one dose, with 877,000 fully vaccinated.  

Medicaid vaccine gift cards will continue to be available to eligible Ohioans through Dec. 31, 2021. 

For more on Ohio’s Medicaid Managed Care Organizations, visit https://medicaid.oahp.org/. 

Media Contact: Celina Fabrizio
cfabrizio@werthpr.com
Download the press release

title: See a doctor from the comfort of your home, Paramount Health Care

content.content:
Did you know you can have a telehealth doctor visit from the comfort of your home? You may be able to see your doctor without leaving your home or workplace. For a telehealth visit, you will use your telephone, smart phone, or tablet to have a call or video visit with your doctor.

Telehealth is a safe and convenient alternative to traditional in-person visits for managing some health care needs. Receive care from the comfort of your home or work with no need to travel, rearrange your busy schedule, or manage childcare. By using telehealth services, you will no longer need to sit in the waiting area or risk exposure during cold and flu season.

Telehealth can be used in combination with routine visits to your doctor to monitor health conditions, like diabetes or high blood pressure. In addition, some common symptoms that may be treated during a telehealth visit are cough, fever, headache, runny nose, sore throat, and other cold or flu symptoms. Telehealth visits are covered by your health plan. Please contact your doctor’s office to check if they offer telehealth appointments.

Learn more about telehealth visits

title: 7 strategies for cutting back or quitting drinking, Paramount Health Care

content.content:
7 strategies for cutting back or quitting drinking

This April, during Alcohol Awareness Month, Paramount encourages you to learn about the dangers of drinking too much.

“Drinking too much alcohol increases people’s risk of injuries, violence, drowning, liver disease, and some types of cancer.”

—Dee Ann Bialecki-Haase, MD, family medicine doctor and chief medical officer for Paramount.

If you are drinking too much, you can improve your health by cutting back or quitting. Dr. Bialecki-Haase offers these strategies to help:

  1. Limit your drinking to no more than 1 drink a day for women or 2 drinks a day for men.
  2. Keep track of how much you drink.
  3. Choose a day each week when you will not drink.
  4. Don’t drink when you are upset.
  5. Limit the amount of alcohol you keep at home.
  6. Avoid places where people drink a lot.
  7. Make a list of reasons not to drink.

If you are concerned about someone else’s drinking, offer to help. If you are concerned about your own drinking, talk with your primary care provider about available resources.

title: Wearing a Face Mask: Tips on How to Properly Mask

content.content:
As we enter our new normal, we can all agree it’s anything but ordinary. However, it’s important to take extra precautions to protect yourself and your loved ones. One way we can do this is by wearing a mask while in public.

Follow the steps below before putting on or taking off your mask. Donning (Putting on):

  1. To get started, complete hand hygiene. That means wash your hands with soap and water for at least 20 seconds or use hand sanitizer before touching the mask.
  2. Check to make sure that there are no obvious tears or holes on either side of the mask.
  3. Follow the instructions below for the type of mask you are using.
    • Face mask with ear loops: Hold the mask by the ear loops. Place a loop around each ear.
    • Face mask with ties: Bring the mask to nose level, place the ties over the crown of your head, and secure with a bow.
    • Face mask with bands: Hold the mask with your hand in the nosepiece or top of the masks at fingertips, allowing the headbands to hang freely below hands. Bring the mask to nose level and pull the top strap over your head so that it rests over the crown of your head. Pull the bottom strap over your head so that it rests at the nape of your neck.
  4. Ensure that the top of the mask is covering your nose.
  5. Pull the bottom of the mask over your mouth and chin.
  6. Complete hand hygiene again, after placing your mask on your face.

Doffing (Taking off):

  1. Once again, wash your hands before touching your face mask.
  2. Only touch the ear loops/ties/band. Do not touch your eyes, nose or mouth. Follow the instructions below for the type of mask you are using.
    • Face mask with ear loops: Hold both of the ear loops and gently lift and remove the mask.
    • Face mask with ties: Untie the bottom bow first then untie the top bow and pull the mask away from you as the ties are loosened.
    • Face mask with bands: Lift the bottom strap over your head then pull the top strap over your head.
  3. Inspect the mask. If there are no holes or tears, you can continue to use the mask when needed.
  4. Launder your mask after every use in warm water with regular detergent.
  5. Finally, wash your hands after removing the mask.

Masking Tips and Reminders:

  • The mask should cover your mouth, nose, and chin.
  • The mask should not be pulled down and worn under your chin (exposing your nose and mouth). You are placing yourself and others at high risk for contamination if your mask is not worn correctly!
  • Avoid touching the front of the mask.
  • Masks are effective only when used in combination with proper hand hygiene.
  • Do not wear the mask if you identify a hole or tear.
  • Wearing a mask does not take the place of social distancing or proper hand hygiene. Remain at least six feet apart and complete hand hygiene frequently.
  • Hold each other accountable! Speak up if you see someone wearing their mask incorrectly.

Learn more about COVID-19
